badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following course on edX, including all assignments: Introduction to System Programming on IBM Z.
Achieve a score of 80% or more on the final quiz at the end of the course.

a4fac9d9-6a06-4fe5-baea-46523e188640.description: Through hands-on labs in an IBM Mainframe z/OS Environment, this credential earner has gained the fundamental practical skills to navigate and work in a z/OS environment. This includes the use of ISPF/PDF dialogs, and TSO/E commands.
a4fac9d9-6a06-4fe5-baea-46523e188640.name: Introduction to z/OS Commands and Panels on IBM Z

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following course on edX, including all assignments: Introduction to z/OS Commands and Panels on IBM Z.
Achieve a score of 80% or more on the final quiz at the end of the course.

57b47176-2e09-4d7a-8f0f-975c4f7992ab.description: This credential earner understands how to dissect malware to gather information about the malware functionality, identify how the system was compromised, and defend against future attacks. Earners also understand the fundamentals of Assembly language, basic Win32 Assembly programming concepts, and how Reverse Engineers use Assembly to analyze malware.
57b47176-2e09-4d7a-8f0f-975c4f7992ab.name: Malware Analysis and Assembly Language Introduction

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Malware Analysis and Assembly Language Introduction course on edX, including all course modules, reading, and other assignments.
Achieve a passing grade on each of the 7 graded quizzes contained throughout the course.

027fc43d-0110-44a3-98c6-b6bf1338531f.description: This credential earner has demonstrated a foundational knowledge of NoSQL databases. The earner can define the four categories of NoSQL databases, as well as the architecture and features of several NoSQL databases, including MongoDB, Cassandra, and IBM Cloudant. The earner has hands-on experience using NoSQL databases to perform standard database management tasks, such as creating and replicating databases, modifying database permissions, indexing and aggregating data, and sharing data.
027fc43d-0110-44a3-98c6-b6bf1338531f.name: NoSQL Database Essentials

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following course on edX, including all assignments: NoSQL Database Basics
Pass all graded assessments and earn a course certificate on edX.org.

e0e1a543-ba90-45f0-a8f0-81653dd9382c.description: Through participation in hands-on labs, this badge earner has gained experience and has the basic skills required to write programs using the REXX language in z/OS. This includes the TSO extensions to REXX and interaction with other environments such as the MVS console, running REXX in batch jobs, and compiling REXX.
e0e1a543-ba90-45f0-a8f0-81653dd9382c.name: z/OS REXX Programming

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following course on edX, including all assignments: z/OS REXX Programming.
Achieve a score of 80% or more on the final quiz at the end of the course.

417730fe-8514-4099-9c3c-f4ffc3ed2a32.description: This badge earner understands an overview of UNIX System Services, the role of z/OS as a server in the open systems environment, & how open standards are implemented in a z/OS system by z/OS UNIX. They can identify basic terms used in z/OS UNIX, define components of z/OS UNIX, explain major functions provided in z/OS UNIX, discuss opportunities for applications in a z/OS UNIX environment, identify z/OS base elements & optional features that make up z/OS UNIX, & use the 2 interactive interfaces.
417730fe-8514-4099-9c3c-f4ffc3ed2a32.name: An Introduction to z/OS UNIX System Services

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following course on edX, including all assignments: An Introduction to z/OS UNIX System Services.
Pass all graded assessments and earn a course certificate on edX.org.

c402db7e-bfcb-45cc-96f4-c0b835bdda8c.description: This credential earner has demonstrated a foundational knowledge of data engineering. The earner has implemented various concepts in the data engineering lifecycle and gained a working knowledge of Python, Relational Databases, NoSQL Data Stores, Big Data Engines, Data Warehouses, and Data Pipelines. The earner has demonstrated the skills required for an entry-level data engineering role.
c402db7e-bfcb-45cc-96f4-c0b835bdda8c.name: Data Engineering Capstone

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the course Data Engineering Capstone Project on edX.org.
Pass all graded assessments and earn a course certificate on edX.org.

bb134c86-93eb-4f16-9285-18587fdaca79.description: This credential earner has demonstrated a foundational knowledge of test driven development (TDD). The earner can relate the importance of TDD to software development; describe test-driven development (TDD) and explain its benefits for DevOps; develop unit tests with test assertions and test fixtures and then run the tests using the Python Nose test package; and perform unit testing with TDD methods such as coverage reports, factories, fakes, and mock objects.
bb134c86-93eb-4f16-9285-18587fdaca79.name: Introduction to Test Driven Development

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the Test and Behavior Driven Development (TDD/BDD) course on edX.
Pass all graded assessments and earn a course certificate on edX.org.

9b37b1af-9b1e-48c3-91ee-a2cc9debc3d9.description: This credential earner can explain the importance of monitoring and observability and describe monitoring and observability concepts like Golden Signals. The earner can read app performance metrics and troubleshoot using logging, stack trace, and log analytics. They understand monitoring techniques and have hands-on experience with monitoring tools like Promethus and Grafana, and data visualization tools like Kibana and Splunk.
9b37b1af-9b1e-48c3-91ee-a2cc9debc3d9.name: Monitoring and Observability for Application Developers

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following course on edX, including all assignments: Monitoring and Observability for Application Developers.
Pass all graded assessments and earn a course certificate on edX.org.

bc801a68-887d-4a1d-bac4-435f875747f7.description: Through completion of an extensive learning journey, this badge earner has gained deep knowledge on how to safely update apps using the latest technologies to deliver changes at the speed of business.
bc801a68-887d-4a1d-bac4-435f875747f7.name: Architecting Applications with IBM Z

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM

badge_template_activities.title: Complete the following course on edX, including all assignments: Architecting Applications for IBM Z and Cloud.
Achieve a score of 80% or more on the final quiz at the end of the course.

d386fa30-2e83-4937-82c1-acebb00c78ba.description: This credential earner has demonstrated proficiency in DevOps practices. The earner understands how to develop, test, deploy, monitor, and enhance a secure microservices-based application on cloud over the course of several sprints. The earner can build and execute a sprint plan and can utilize a variety of agile, cloud native, and CI/CD tools and technologies.
d386fa30-2e83-4937-82c1-acebb00c78ba.name: DevOps Capstone

issuer.summary: issued by edX and authorized by IBM
